result.execSummary:
The defendant Justin R. Gibbs was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Fraud/Innkeeper-Intent/Defraud (<=$2500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.21(1m)(b).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Justin R. Gibbs in court with attorney Steven G. Richards.  Defendant Justin R. Gibbs in custody.  Mary Margaret Sowinski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

15cf265 -  Count 1 - 9 months CC - costs waived
Count 2- 4 years - 2 years in/2 years ES - Rest 761 total - costs waived

15cf212 - State moves to dismiss but read counts 3--7 -
15cf265 - State moves to dismiss but read in counts 3 and 4
15cf266 - State moves to dismiss but read in counts 1 and 4 - and dismiss repeater enhancer in counts 2 and 3 - 
VIctim rights have been complied with -
Motions granted by Court
Plea questionnaire filed for each case - Defendant pleads no contest to amended count 1 in 15cf150, counts 1 and 2 in 15cf212, Counts 1 and 2 in 15cf265, Counts 2 and 3 w/o repeater in 15cf266 and 16cf53 as charged -   Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. SUmmary marked and received as exhibit 1  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 28, 2016 at 10:45 am.

11:11 a.m. Defendant Justin R. Gibbs in court with attorney Steven Richards.  Mary Margaret Sowinski, Asst. DA, appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 15CF175, 15CF150, 15CF265, 15CF212, 16CF53, 15CF266, 16CF53, 15CF266, 14FO971, 14TR1047, 14TR1165, 14TR1046, 14TR1657, 15FO659, 15TR1543, 14TR1606, 15TR1486, 14TR1656. Attorney Steven Richards notifies the court he will be assigned to all pending cases; waiting for public defender appointment/he has not seen paperwork; expects global resolution. Requests adjournment. Sowinski statement. 16CF53 - defendant waives preliminary hearing; waiver free and voluntary, binds defendant over. Richards in receipt of Information, pleads not guilty. Defendant advises he will begin making payments next week/will be reviewed at time of PTC. Bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 2, 2016 at 11:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on June 7, 2016 at 11:00 am.

9:08 am Defendant Justin R. Gibbs in court in custody with attorney Daniel Francis Snyder.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 15cf265, 15cf266, 15cf212, 15cf150, 15cf175, 14tr1165,14tr1606, 14tr1656, 14tr1657, 15tr1486, 14fo971, 14tr1046, 14tr1047, 15fo659, 15tr1543. Bednar statement to cases; statement to bond in 15cf265 and 15cf266; statement that defendant is scheduled for sentencing after revocation in Branch 2 next week.  In 15cf265 and 266, Snyder in receipt of complaints, waive reading- waive preliminary hearings. Court sets $5,000 sig bond in each of 15cf265 and 15cf266. Bail continued in all other matters. Snyder statement to review fines at next pre-trial date. Court quashes any outstanding warrants on unpaid fines. Adj. 9:16 a.m.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 10, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
